rationale: The agent removed logging for trusted system classes in PolicyManager.java but went too far by removing ALL logging in isTriviallyAllowed(), including debug/trace logs for non-system cases that were safe to keep. Ground truth only changed two debug logs to trace and removed one specific log with a comment, keeping the final trace log intact. Agent completely missed the ClusterSettingsIT.java test changes (TRACEâ†’DEBUG level adjustments), which is a major omission. The overly aggressive removal of all logging statements violates best practices since some logging was intentionally preserved in ground truth for debugging purposes.
